title: Latest ET Manufacturing | Latest Manufacturing News : ETManufacturing.in

items.title: Lumax to open China office this year
items.summary:
- Lumax will open its first China office this year as a group resource centre to access advanced *auto-electronics* trends and improve sourcing/tech scouting.
- The move to a *Tier 0.5* model means end-to-end bundles and co‑development with OEMs, backed by a Bengaluru software hub (*SHIFT*) to integrate software with vehicle architecture.
- Mega plants and a reoriented supply chain signal a shift from component supply to *systems integration*, while India remains the growth focus and engineers shift to electronics/software.

items.title: Novartis to acquire Tourmaline Bio for $1.4 billion
Indian pharma: price hikes, IP transfers to curb tariffs
items.summary:
- The Indian pharma sector needs *price hikes*, *site transfers*, and *IP transfers* to counter ongoing US tariff uncertainty, per Systematix Research.
- Tariff uncertainty persists with cautious US capacity expansion; raw material prices are correcting in antibiotics and generic API prices have stabilized, while **GLP-1** opportunities and CDMO demand rise.
- 1QFY26 was weak for many players, with US margins eroded, but *Sun Pharma* and *Pfizer* posted strength even as *Orchid Pharma*, *Dr Reddy's* and *Piramal* faced pressure, signaling near-term challenges but long-term growth prospects.

items.title: Goyal urges exporters to prioritise local supply chains
items.summary:
- Goyal urged exporters to prioritise *local supply chains* to strengthen *economic security* amid global trade uncertainties.
- He linked the push to **Atmanirbhar Bharat**, urged passing *GST relief* to consumers to boost *domestic demand* and growth, and highlighted government support against rising tariffs.
- He called for upgrading *product quality*, diversifying *supply chains*, adopting new technologies and *sustainable practices*, with the government backing a favorable ecosystem for exporters.

items.title: Uni Abex to double high-performance alloys capacity
items.summary:
- **Uni Abex Alloy Products Ltd** will invest over ₹100 crore to double its production capacity from 6,000 to 12,000 metric tonnes per annum of *high-performance alloys* by FY2025-26 at its Dharwad, Karnataka facility.
- The *brownfield expansion* adds one new dedicated manufacturing line, bringing capacity to two specialised lines to meet rising demand from iron & steel, petrochemicals, fertilisers, aerospace, energy, automotive and medical sectors.
- The move is backed by the **Neterwala Group**, with *Kuldeep Bhan* (Group President - Global Metallurgy) saying the investment aligns with government-led growth in these sectors.

items.title: QCY to set up manufacturing in Haryana, India
items.summary:
- *QCY* announced entry into India's market with plans to set up a manufacturing facility in Manesar, Haryana, and partner with *WooDoo Ventures Private Limited* for marketing and distribution.
- The company targets a **$75-100 million** value share by 2026 under the **Make in India** initiative, with India's wearable tech market growing from *$1.3B* in 2024 to *$1.5B* by 2026.
- It will launch six flagship products across *TWS*, headphones, and speakers, backed by collaborations with **Qualcomm** and a sizable global manufacturing footprint.

items.title: Incentive scheme in works for construction gear
items.summary:
- The Centre is finalising a ₹14,000-16,000 crore incentive scheme to promote local production of key construction gear, including *tunnel boring machines (TBMs)* and cranes, with inter-ministerial consultations underway.
- Indigenisation could rise to **70-80%** in 5–7 years, cutting imports from abroad and potentially saving about **$3 billion** in forex annually.
- A dedicated **Production-Linked Incentive (PLI)** scheme for EPC machinery and stronger **Make in India** procurement could boost project planning, but domestic capacity readiness remains a hurdle.

items.title: FCC moves to bar some Chinese labs from testing
items.summary:
- **FCC** begins withdrawing recognition from seven *Chinese labs* due to *national security* concerns and bars them from testing U.S. electronics.
- The FCC notes about 75% of electronics are tested in labs in *China*, with four labs' recognition expired since May.
- FCC Chairman Brendan Carr warns that foreign adversary governments should not own or control the labs certifying devices for the U.S. market.

items.title: Netskope eyeing up to $6.5B valuation in US IPO
items.summary:
- Netskope seeks a valuation of up to **$6.5 billion** in its U.S. IPO, selling 47.8 million shares at **$15–$17** to raise up to **$813 million**.
- The Santa Clara-based company provides **cloud security software** for apps, websites and data, with customers including **Qualcomm** and **BMO**.
- **Morgan Stanley** and **J.P. Morgan** lead the underwriting, with Netskope listing on Nasdaq under the ticker **NTSK**.

items.title: Haryana to become hub of drone technology, says Haryana CM
items.summary: - Haryana aims to become a hub of *drone technology*, with the first drone manufacturing hub at Sisai village in Hisar—the largest in South Asia.\n- CM Nayab Singh Saini announced a roadmap for *Viksit Haryana* to realise PM Modi's *Viksit Bharat* by 2047, noting 252 pilots and 136 technicians certified by DGCA (including 53 women).\n- Drones will empower rural communities through schemes like *Namo Drone Didi* and *Kisan Drone*, boosting agriculture and employment.

items.title: Bharat Forge plans defence complex for missiles, space launch vehicles; shares gain over 5%
Vedanta invests over ₹12,500 crore in metal manufacturing for EV sector
Gautam Solar to invest ₹4000 crore to set up 5 GW solar cell manufacturing plant in Madhya Pradesh
RRP Electronics signs four strategic MoUs at Semicon India 2025 to enhance India's semiconductor ecosystem
Yudh Abhyas 2025: Indian, US soldiers conduct live drills in Alaska to boost defence ties
India seeks Pakistan clash insights to woo arms buyers
items.summary:
- The May clash showcased *India's new warfare vision*, including the domestically built *invisible shield* missile defence system, aimed at fuelling overseas demand.
- Defence exports hit a record $2.8B in 2024–25 and domestic production rose to about $18B, signaling a shift to major weapons exporting.
- Analysts call the conflict a *market demonstrator*, with BrahMos missiles drawing interest from many countries despite export and geopolitical challenges.

items.title: India revokes grid access for 17 GW of clean energy projects
items.summary:
- India cancelled grid access for nearly *17 GW* of delayed clean energy projects to prioritise connections for those operational or nearing completion.
- The revocation followed CTUIL inspections and affected projects in Rajasthan, Gujarat and Madhya Pradesh, including Adani Green Energy, ReNew Power, NTPC, JSW Energy and Avaada Group.
- The move aligns with India's push to reach *500 GW of non-fossil fuel power capacity* by 2030, even as the transmission network lags generation.

items.title: India eyes 200 warships, submarines by 2035
items.summary:
- India aims to grow its Navy to over 200 warships and submarines by 2035 to secure maritime interests amid *China* and *Pakistan*.
- Currently 55 vessels are under construction at about ₹99,500 crore, with an AoN for 74 indigenous ships.
- Analysts say the expansion could have a multiplier effect on the economy and strengthen India's *blue-water* capability.

items.title: CATL sees Hungarian production start by early 2026
items.summary:
- CATL's Debrecen plant targets production by early 2026, with a planned 100 GWh annual capacity and about 9,000 jobs. 
- The €7.3 billion project aims to boost European battery output for automakers such as BMW, Stellantis and Volkswagen. 
- Funding includes a $4.6 billion HK IPO to support the Hungarian project; leadership notes demand fluctuations but an overall EV uptrend remains intact.

items.title: QCY to set up manufacturing in Haryana, India
items.author: PTI
items.summary:
- QCY announced its foray into India with plans to set up a manufacturing facility in *Manesar, Haryana*. 
- The company targets a USD 75-100 million market share by 2026, backed by investments in manufacturing, R&D, and distribution under **Make in India**. 
- India's wearable tech market is expected to grow from USD 1.3B in 2024 to 1.5B by 2026, as QCY expands its offline retail network and global footprint.

items.title: Iron ore gains on lower shipments, strong China steel exports
GST cuts: Car, bike, FMCG and online platforms reduce prices
From boardroom to policy: Pandey bridging two worlds
items.author: ETAuto Desk
items.summary: - *Rama Shankar Pandey* moves from boardrooms to public service by joining the Indian Administrative Fellowship to transform public systems with technology-led innovations.\n- He led *Mission SMILE*, coordinated efforts on *PM-SURAJ*, and reformed *NAPDDR*, expanding beggary rehabilitation, credit access, and data-driven delivery.\n- This journey shows how *industry rigor* can bridge corporate ambition with Sarkaar priorities for lasting governance impact.

items.title: Ester Loop lands India's first infinite-loop recycling plant
items.author: ETManufacturing Desk
items.summary:
- Ester Industries and Loop Industries’ JV ELITe plan to acquire land near Surat, Gujarat, for India’s first *infinite loop* recycling facility, starting at 70,000 tpa and expanding later. 
- It will recycle polyester waste into virgin-quality *PET resin*, run on ~80% renewable energy, and targets up to an *80% reduction* in carbon emissions versus petroleum-based PET. 
- Located in PCPIR, it benefits from feedstock access, skilled workers, and port facilities, underscoring Gujarat’s role in India’s circular economy.

items.title: Jindal Steel targets 12 million tonnes crude steel output in FY26
AI data centres could consume over 1 billion litres of water annually by 2028: Morgan Stanley
Gautam Solar to invest ₹4,000 crore in 5 GW plant in MP
items.summary:
- Gautam Solar to invest ₹4,000 crore to set up a 5 GW solar cell plant in Madhya Pradesh.
- The 54-acre Gwalior project will be implemented in phases, starting with 2 GW by 2026 and an IPO to add 3 GW later.
- The move aims to deepen domestic solar manufacturing and build a fully integrated *solar value chain* in India.

items.title: JK Cement starts work on ₹3,000-crore greenfield plant in Jaisalmer
GPS Renewables to manufacture paddle agitators in partnership with Germany's Biogastechnik Sud
GREW Solar raises ₹300 crore to develop new products, expand capacity
Volkswagen CEO: tariffs have cost group billions so far
items.summary:
- *Tariffs* have cost Volkswagen Group several *billion euros* so far this year, according to CEO *Oliver Blume*. 
- He noted the US tariffs remain high (27.5%) with talks of a 15% cut and mentioned possible tax breaks for planned investments, including a local Audi plant. 
- Blume described VW as in a *sandwich* between faltering *China* and the *US*, pressuring Porsche and Audi.

items.title: Vikram Solar bags 336 MW Khavda order
items.summary:
- **Vikram Solar** bags a 336 MW module order from *L&T Construction* for the Khavda project in Gujarat.  
- The order uses **Hypersol G12R** N-type modules to boost BOS efficiency and reduce the **LCOE**.  
- Vikram Solar previously secured a 326 MW order from *GIPCL* for the Khavda Renewable Energy Park in May 2025.

items.title: LG Electronics IPO in India this October
items.author: Himadri Buch, ET Bureau
items.summary:
- LG Electronics is set to launch its India IPO in *October*, targeting about *₹15,000 crore*.
- The issue will comprise around *10.2 crore shares* (about *15%* of the local arm), making it the largest IPO in 2025 so far.
- Lead managers include *Morgan Stanley India*, *JP Morgan India*, *Axis Capital*, *BofA Securities India*, and *Citigroup Global Markets India* as market momentum remains bullish.

items.title: LG Electronics IPO in India this October
items.author: Himadri Buch, ET Bureau
items.summary: - *LG Electronics* plans to launch its Indian IPO in October, aiming to raise ₹15,000 crore, the largest in 2025 so far.\n- It will offer **15%** stake or **10.2 crore** shares, with Sebi approval and leading banks such as Morgan Stanley, JP Morgan, BofA Securities, and Citi as book-running lead managers.\n- The delay from spring was due to volatility and global headwinds; October is viewed as the right window amid a busy IPO pipeline.

items.title: FMCG firms urge sale of old MRP packs after GST cuts
items.summary:
- *FMCG firms* are urging the government to allow selling stock at lower prices using existing MRP packaging after the GST cuts take effect.
- They warn about discarding packaging worth over ₹2,000 crore and propose using pre-printed stock with ads informing consumers about the new prices to limit wastage.
- They also seek rounding MRPs to the nearest rupee/50 paise and to treat promo offers as valid tax benefits to ease implementation.

items.title: BJP MPs urge pass-on of GST cut to consumers
items.summary: - The resolution urges manufacturers and traders to pass-on every *GST* saving to the **One Nation, One Tax** vision benefiting the *consumer*.\n- Lower prices will fuel higher demand, boosting prosperity for businesses and strengthening trust between shopkeepers and customers.\n- *GST* reforms simplify the system, reduce essentials prices and show rising revenue collection as proof of greater compliance and growth.

items.title: ACME Solar orders 2 GWh Battery Energy Storage
items.summary:
- ACME Solar orders a *2 GWh Battery Energy Storage System* from Chuzhou Lishen New Energy Technology with POSCO International and China FAW Group, for ACME's *FDRE* and standalone *BESS* projects.
- Delivery will be phased over *6–10 months*, with commissioning in *12–18 months*, bringing cumulative BESS procurement to over *5 GWh* after the prior *3.1 GWh* order in July 2025.
- Nikhil Dhingra, CEO of ACME Solar, calls it a strategic procurement that strengthens ties with *POSCO International* and *Lishen* in India's growing BESS market.

items.title: India’s graphite gets zero duty access in US, but conditions apply
items.author: Mukul Yudhveer Singh
items.summary:
- The US exempts Indian-origin *graphite* from tariffs, giving India a cost edge in the growing *EV battery* supply chain. 
- The exemption is conditional on a **framework agreement** with enforceable commitments to fair and reciprocal trade and alignment with US security priorities. 
- Long-term gains depend on India securing the agreement to attract investment and diversify the global supply chain away from China.

items.title: Trump urges legal hiring after Hyundai raid; 300 workers
items.author: Divyadeep Singh, ET Bureau
items.summary: - Following the Hyundai Georgia raid that detained 475 workers, *Trump* urged foreign companies to bring their skills to the U.S. **legally** and to hire and train American workers.\n- He said foreign manufacturing experts could be allowed to help train U.S. workers, but stressed the alliance with **South Korea** should stay intact.\n- South Korea plans to bring home **300 detained workers**, with a charter flight and talks led by the foreign minister.

items.title: Goa's waste-to-biogas plant runs 9 years: CM
items.summary:
- *Goa* is the first state to set up a municipal solid waste to **biogas** and **biogas to energy** plant, now operating for nine years.
- The CM noted Goa has transported five lakh tonnes of refuse-derived fuel to cement plants, saving **three lakh tonnes of coal**, and pioneered the **deposit refund scheme** for **multi-layered plastic waste**.
- A biomass network under **Goa Energy Development Agency (GEDA)** includes a 40 TPD plant at Saligao and a biomass-aggregation portal to support horticulturists and local bodies, with plans to convert more plastics to fuel.

items.title: GST cut to boost private investment in biogas sector
Companies reset sustainability goals amid extreme weather surge
BPCL gets clearance to draft ToR for ₹1.03 lakh crore refinery-petrochem project in Andhra Pradesh
ChrysCapital, InCred Invest ₹1,200 Cr in ILJIN Electronics
items.summary:
- ILJIN Electronics India, Amber Group's electronics arm, raised *₹1,200 crore* in strategic funding from **ChrysCapital** and **InCred Growth Partners Fund I**, with *₹1,100 crore* from ChrysCapital and *₹100 crore* from InCred. 
- This is ILJIN's first external institutional capital raise, enabling scale-up of operations and potential acquisitions to strengthen its *PCB* and *EMS* leadership. 
- Amber Group also highlighted expansion moves into energy storage and industrial automation, with deals like **Power-One Micro Systems** and **Unitronics plc** to grow in *EV charging*, *BESS*, and related segments.

items.title: Indian semicon consortium bags deal for 5 lakh cameras
items.author: Suraksha P, ETtech
items.summary: - **Kaynes Semicon-led consortium**, with partners like NXP Semiconductors and CDAC, has won contracts to supply over 5 lakh indigenous dash and surveillance cameras by year-end. - These cameras are the *first in India* to be engineered, packaged, and produced locally, with **50% localisation by 2026** and **90% by 2030**. - CEO Raghu Panicker says the project aims to build a *scalable India-based hardware ecosystem*.

items.title: Govt to fast-track next round of India Semiconductor Mission
items.summary:
- The government plans to fast-track *ISM 2.0* approval, with a cabinet note by end-October and applications by year-end.
- *ISM 2.0* would broaden support to the full semiconductor value chain—*compound semiconductor fabs*, advanced packaging, display fabs, capital equipment, chemicals & gases, and fabless design.
- Industry is pushing for a higher outlay and a stronger local supply chain, with subsidies varying by category and ISM 1.0 projects moving toward domestic sourcing.

items.title: ASML becomes Mistral AI's top shareholder after leading latest funding round
Africa's solar potential fuels renewables future
items.summary:
- Africa holds *60%* of the world's best **solar resources**, yet only *2%* of global clean energy investments in 2024, leaving hundreds of millions without electricity. 
- Ambitious goals like **300 GW by 2030** and up to **90% renewables by 2050**, with projects such as the **KHI Solar One**, show a path to broad electrification through solar. 
- The Africa Climate Summit and rising solar trade signal faster deployment that could boost health, education and economic growth across the continent.

items.title: Steel industry seeks AI in value chain for green financing
items.summary: - The two-day Steel Conclave 2025 will explore leveraging *AI* in the steel value chain and financing the *green transition* for sector growth.\n- Discussions will cover increasing *iron ore availability*, decarbonisation, price risk management, and *logistics* efficiency to build a resilient, future-ready industry in India.\n- The event coincides with government steps such as GST relief on renewable energy products to 5%, helping shift to *green power* and lower emissions.

items.title: Food Min to open chemical lab for food safety
items.summary: - Pralhad Joshi will inaugurate a new chemical laboratory at the National Test House, Ghaziabad, on Sept 10 to bolster quality testing across industries. - The facility will test drinking water, packaging materials, cement and metals, and is NABL accredited to ISO/IEC 17025:2017 with BIS and FSSAI approvals. - Equipped with AAS, GC-MS and HPLC, it plans fortified foods, spices and micronutrient analysis, and will train universities and industries.
